segments.text: My attention keeps returning to the boy on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's so intent on getting those cookies, but the stool looks incredibly unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Its legs are splayed out, and it's definitely tilting backward at an alarming angle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm genuinely worried he's going to lose his balance and fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of him hitting his head on the counter or floor makes me wince.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can he not feel how precarious his position is right now?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little sister, standing below, doesn't seem to notice the danger either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're both so focused on the prize in the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like a ticking time bomb, that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm practically holding my breath watching him try to maintain his balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone really needs to steady that stool before he gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole cookie raid is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
